quote.text: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this fellow perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest it.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked him, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But they cried, saying, Crucify him, crucify him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let him go.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And, behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counsellor; and he was a good man, and a just:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: This man went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
quote.author: Luke
